roleset.name: (cause to) be not level, motion according
roleset.note: TILT-V NOTES: Member of VNcls other_cos-45.4, spatial_configuration-47.6 (from tilt.01-v)

role.descr: destination (goal actually reached by tilting), end state

example.name: most intuitive usage
example.text: As surely as a seesaw tilts, falling interest rates force up the price of previously issued bonds.

example.name: all args
example.text: Mr. Black said he is ``pleased'' with the economy's recent performance, and doesn't see ``a lot of excesses out there that-1 *trace*-1 would tilt us into recession.''
example.arg: that -> a lot of excesses out there

example.name: ergative with arg2
example.text: Will he, if he wins, be in the thrall of the most liberal of his allies, who advocate such policies as rent control for commercial buildings, or will he tilt toward the real-estate interests that have funneled money into his campaign?
example.arg: toward the real-estate interests that have funneled money into his campaign
